message_1: Suppose there are 10 farmers who all share a common grazing land. Each farmer's cow needs 2 acres to graze. The total grazing land available is 20 acres. If each farmer maximizes their own gain by bringing as many cows as possible to the common land, what is the maximum number of cows that can graze on the land before it becomes overgrazed?
message_2:
If each cow needs 2 acres to graze and there are 20 acres available, then the maximum number of cows that can graze on the land without it becoming overgrazed is:

20 acres / 2 acres per cow = 10 cows
